title: Typographic mini book
content:
What subject would you choose to express typographically in a mini book just filled with good experimental typography?

 [‹ Font Explorer X - PC Launch?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015165950/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41724 "Go to previous forum topic") [what is the stereotypical behavior and appearance of a designer? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015165950/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14186 "Go to next forum topic")
author: missgiggles

comments.content:
The poetry of Emily Dickinson.  
The pyramids of skulls left in the wake of Timur.  
The deranged writings of American outsider artist Howard Finster.  
Engrish.  
Modernist dogma.  
The endless stream of nonsense spewing out of the people running for the Presidency of the United States.
I think a treatise on the “strike beard” would be good - I see beard related typography as a neglected area.
• The Mini Book: Space & Poster Design
Haley: How do you mean copypasta? Huh? It just a book with experimental typography. Geez...millions of people have done them!
Why, smut of course! BarbaBruhn at [Fountain](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015165950/http:/www.fountain.nu/fountaineer/urgentbooklet.asp) proves this is as relevant as it’s fun.

Random snippets from famous sayings superimposed.

ChrisL

<cite>smut?</cite>

If your country they call it page 3.
